reviews.text: This Victorian-era guest house is within a ten-minute drive of the main attractions of the Royal Mile and Arthur's Seat, and is in reasonably good condition. I had a rather small single room on the third floor of the annex, several doors down and across the street from the main building. My bed was comfortable, the bath and shower clean and modern, and the room, looking out the rear of the building, was nice and quiet. Since we were there on a Sunday, on-street parking was available; otherwise, parking is scarce.
reviews.title: Reasonable guest house in good downtown Edinburgh location.

reviews.text: A major plus are the breakfasts, served in a bright, clean conservatory located at the rear of the main building. The manager was able to provide some excellent Scots porridge for us, upon request, since it is not normally available in the summer months. A wide variety of cereals, breads and the usual cooked items on a full Scottish breakfast were served.
reviews.title: The staff were the redeeming feature!

reviews.text: The duty manager, who appeared to be a college student, was very helpful and attentive to our needs. The Balmore was a reasonable value for the modest price paid.
reviews.title: Average guest house

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The main problem for us (and the reason I wouldn't recommend this B&B) was that we had so little sleep, despite buying ear-plugs after the first awful night - Some of the rooms appear to have had en-suites 'added in', and these are 'inside' other people's bedrooms. This is hard to explain, (bear with me!) - Next door's ensuite was built into our room, not with a full wall, but with a thin partial wall that reached to a metre or so from the ceiling. We could hear every noise that next door made, from their toilet habits (in gruesome detail), to their late-night showers, and every time they switched the bathroom light on in the night it lit up our bedroom ceiling! As our ensuite was built into the next room, I imagine they had the same problem. Other things weren't ideal - for example, there is no reception desk so when we arrived we felt a little bit lost and ended up in the breakfast room looking for staff; As such, help on finding our way around/maps etc wasn't offered, and we had to ask for this. No-one asked how our stay was, and my Mum stopped me making a complaint as she didn't want to be thought of as a problem. Also, the luggage storage was simply putting our bags in the corner of the breakfast room, which didn't feel very secure.
reviews.title: Cheap + Cheerful (well a little bit)

reviews.text: On a brighter note, the staff were lovely and friendly, and the cooked breakfast was great, although choice was limited (no porridge, no fresh fruit). The room was spotlessly clean, there were extra blankets in the bedroom, and the bathroom was a good size. For us though, this wasn't enough to justify lack of sleep! Especially as the trip was a present for my Mum's special birthday, so I had hoped for better.
reviews.title: Lovely 4 nights

reviews.text: I stayed here for five nights, in the single room at the top floor of the annexe. The whole building looked like it had recently been renovated, new paint, new furniture etc. The room was quiet and cosy and the wi-fi and tv worked (the tv also had loads of channels).
reviews.title: Good B&B for reasonable price

reviews.text: The breakfast buffet was very basic, some cereals and toast; but most people chose the cooked breakfast anyway.
reviews.title: Great B&B in Edinburgh

reviews.text: The staff was ok, but not always very friendly - the guy who checked me in was very short, almost ran off without asking whether I had questions, no small talk etc. The owner when checking out was also a bit rushed.
reviews.title: Very good experience

reviews.text: But overall a good experience for a good price.
reviews.title: Awful and overpriced

reviews.text: Great deal with EasyFly and the Hotel (£50 for one night), free wifi, good breakfast (included) , clean and very good room....walk for 10 minutes and you will be at Edinburgh Castle. Remember always to bring an umbrella!!!
reviews.title: filthy water heater, no wireless, unfriendly owner

reviews.text: The room was large with a bizarre furniture outlay. The location was perfect, central and with easy reach to everything we needed. Breakfast is taken in a nice verandalike room with a view over greenery.
reviews.title: Unwelcoming guesthouse - disappointed

reviews.text: We stayed there on the 8th of June. The reception of the staff was unwelcoming and despite me reporting that I had a booking with booking.com the sole staff said 'let's see if we have any rooms'. He also asked to see the price I had paid through booking.com which I found odd. The room was on the third floor with no elevator (not a severe factor, just inconvenient for my elderly parents in law who were staying). The room was quite large but the outlay of the furniture was illogical, with the bed facing the room and blocking the access to the window. Finally the tv was broken and when I went to complain to the clerk he claimed it was a problem with Virgin and would be fixed within hours, instead it stayed broken the next morning while the tv in the lobby worked fine... So probably the staff preferred lying about the tv than admit that the cable was broken. Again, not a huge problem normally but my parents in law really rely on being able to watch tv. Finally, there was a duvet lying on the floor right outside the room that room- service had failed to get out of the way. This final touch made this stay feel like a budget experience but at a premium price. We were disappointed.
reviews.title: Pleasant Stay

reviews.text: Overall this is a very pleasant guest house.
reviews.title: VFM

reviews.text: Rooms were spotless and the staff friendly.
reviews.title: Good value

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My one complaint is the requirement to pre order breakfast the day before. As we didn't get around to doing this, we were given a very limited choice and although we came down at just after 8am and there were at least 3 staff covering breakfast, we were told (along with another couple), that there was no time for even a rasher of bacon (although there was a cook in the kitchen). There was very little choice in cererals so made do with toast.
reviews.title: Great place for New Year Hogmanay

reviews.text: Recently had an overnight stay in Family room. Myself with 3 children. Extremely generous sized room, ample space. Room can and would easily accommodate a family of 5. 2 double beds & 1 large single bed. Room was ensuite.
reviews.title: Excellent Family Room

reviews.text: Parking for 2 cars, strictly a first come first serve, owner made a valid point that the location is so central that a car not necessary (if thinking of hiring). Breakfast in conservatory , with a small area with a couple of tables if you wish a bit more privacy. Great breakfast menu, good quality food.
reviews.title: Good, a bit overpriced.
